meanings.definition: Excessive enthusiasm or zeal for a particular cause or belief.
meanings.sent1: Her fanaticisms for animal rights led her to volunteer at the shelter every weekend.
meanings.sent2: His fanaticisms for sports made him the most dedicated fan in the stadium.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fanaticisms for gardening, he couldn't keep a plant alive to save his life.
meanings.sent4: The politician's fanaticisms for power blinded him to the needs of the people.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's fanaticisms for education inspired her students to excel.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a fanatic.
meanings.sent1: The fanaticisms of the group were evident in their extreme actions.
meanings.sent2: The fanaticisms of the fans reached a peak during the championship game.
meanings.sent3: His fanaticisms for cleanliness bordered on obsession.
meanings.sent4: The fanaticisms of the cult leader led his followers astray.
meanings.sent5: The fanaticisms of the artist were reflected in every stroke of the brush.

meanings.definition: The behavior or actions of a fanatic.
meanings.sent1: The fanaticisms of the protestors caught the attention of the media.
meanings.sent2: Her fanaticisms in collecting rare coins consumed all her free time.
meanings.sent3: His fanaticisms for conspiracy theories made him see enemies everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The fanaticisms of the group drove them to extreme measures.
meanings.sent5: The politician's fanaticisms alienated even his most loyal supporters.
